quote: How do you mourn something that never really belonged to you?
author: Rebecca Serle,  When You Were Mine

quote: Grief is love turned into an eternal missing
author: Rosamund Lupton,  Sister

quote: It's a time of sorrow and sadness when we lose a loss of life.
author: George W. Bush

quote: Do not ruin today with mourning tomorrow.
author: Catherynne M. Valente,  The Girl Who Circumnavigated Fairyland in a Ship of Her Own Making

quote: Someday you're gonna look back on this moment of your life as such a sweet time of grieving. You'll see that you were in mourning and your heart was broken, but your life was changing...
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: Grief is an amputation, but hope is incurable haemophilia: you bleed and bleed and bleed. Like Schrödinger’s cat inside a box you can never ever open.
author: David Mitchell,  Slade House

quote: It's so curious: one can resist tears and 'behave' very well in the hardest hours of grief. But then someone makes you a friendly sign behind a window, or one notices that a flower that was in bud only yesterday has suddenly blossomed, or a letter slips from a drawer... and everything collapses.
author: Colette

quote: Tears, idle tears, I know not what they mean, Tears from the depths of some devine despairRise in the heart, and gather to the eyes, In looking on the happy autumn fields, And thinking of the days that are no more.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: But to mourn, that's different. To mourn is to be eaten alive with homesickness for the person.
author: Olive Ann Burns,  Cold Sassy Tree

quote: It is grief that develops the powers of the mind.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Death, so called, is a thing which makes men weep, And yet a third of life is passed in sleep.
author: George Gordon Byron

quote: We have such numerous interests in our lives that it is not uncommon, on a single occasion, for the foundations of a happiness that does not yet exist to be laid down alongside the intensification of a grief from which we are still suffering.
author: Marcel Proust,  Swann's Way

quote: When we lose one we love, our bitterest tears are called forth by the memory of hours when we loved not enough.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: You attend the funeral, you bid the dead farewell. You grieve. Then you continue with your life. And at times the fact of her absence will hit you like a blow to the chest, and you will weep. But this will happen less and less as time goes on. She is dead. You are alive. So live.
author: Neil Gaiman,  The Sandman, Vol. 6: Fables and Reflections

quote: The death of a beloved is an amputation.
author: C.S. Lewis,  A Grief Observed

quote: The whole house seemed to exhale a melancholy breath of emptiness
author: Michael Chabon

quote: Death must be so beautiful. To lie in the soft brown earth, with the grasses waving above one’s head, and listen to silence. To have no yesterday, and no tomorrow. To forget time, to forgive life, to be at peace.
author: Sylvia Plath,  The Bell Jar

quote: The more death, the more birth. People are entering, others are exiting. The cry of a baby, the mourning of others. When others cry, the other are laughing and making merry. The world is mingled with sadness, joy, happiness, anger, wealth, poverty, etc.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson

quote: Chase away sorrow by living
author: Melissa Marr,  Darkest Mercy

quote: There is a sacredness in tears....They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition and of unspeakable love.
author: Washington Irving

quote: It is always betterto avenge dear ones than to indulge in mourning.For every one of us, living in this worldmeans waiting for our end. Let whoever canwin glory before death. When a warrior is gone,that will be his best and only bulwark.
author: Seamus Heaney,  Beowulf

quote: Death! Strange that there should be such a word, and such a thing, and we ever forget it; that one should be living, warm and beautiful, full of hopes, desires and wants, one day, and the next be gone, utterly gone, and forever!
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe,  Uncle Tom's Cabin

quote: Death must be so beautiful. To lie in the soft brown earth, with the grasses waving above one's head, and listen to silence. To have no yesterday, and no tomorrow. To forget time, to forgive life, to be at peace.
author: Oscar Wilde,  The Canterville Ghost

quote: I want words at my funeral. But I guess that means you need life in your life.
author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief

quote: After you have wept and grieved for your physical losses, cherish the functions and the life you have left.
author: Morrie Schwartz

quote: All changes, even the most longed for, have their melancholy; for what we leave behind us is a part of ourselves; we must die to one life before we can enter another.
author: Anatole France

quote: Life is so beautiful that death has fallen in love with it, a jealous, possessive love that grabs at what it can. But life leaps over oblivion lightly, losing only a thing or two of no importance, and gloom is but the passing shadow of a cloud...
author: Yann Martel,  Life of Pi

quote: When love dies, the heart's ashes do not leave on the wind—they rest on the mantelpiece of the soul, darkening the sunrise we once saw to be beautiful.
author: A.M. Hudson

quote: Life is so beautiful that death has fallen in love with it, a jealous possessive love that grabs at what it can.
author: Yann Martel,  Life of Pi

quote: Farewell Hope, and with Hope farewell Fear
author: John Milton

quote: People die. Love endures.
author: Rick Yancey,  The Infinite Sea

quote: No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.
author: C.S. Lewis,  A Grief Observed

quote: Death is Opening Night Everything's that happened yesterday is a rehearsal for everything that will happen...
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Life is full of grief, to exactly the degree we allow ourselves to love other people.
author: Orson Scott Card,  Shadow of the Giant

quote: A lifetime of lonely regret or happiness with some pain along the way.
author: Melissa Nathan,  Persuading Annie

quote: Youth offers the promise of happiness, but life offers the realities of grief.
author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Rescue

quote: What is left when honor is lost?
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Every night when I go to bed, I hope that I may never wake again, and every morning renews my grief.
author: Franz Schubert

quote: Not without hope we suffer and we mourn.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: A tragedy need not have blood and death; it's enough that it all be filled with that majestic sadness that is the pleasure of tragedy.
author: Jean Racine

quote: In times of grief and sorrow I will hold you and rock you and take your grief and make it my own. When you cry I cry and when you hurt I hurt. And together we will try to hold back the floods to tears and despair and make it through the potholed street of life
author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook

quote: There's a sorrow and pain in everyone's life, but every now and then there's a ray of light that melts the loneliness in your heart and brings comfort like hot soup and a soft bed.
author: Hubert Selby Jr.,  Requiem for a Dream

quote: Today we bury his remains in the earth as a seed of immortality. Our hearts are full of sadness, yet at the same time of joyful hope and profound gratitude.
author: Pope Benedict XVI

quote: Sleep is death enjoyed.
author: Friedrich Hebbel

quote: There is no beauty in sadness. No honor in suffering. No growth in fear. No relief in hate. It’s just a waste of perfectly good happiness.
author: Katerina Stoykova Klemer

quote: Wherever the hope of glory lives, hopelessness passes away.
author: Nadine C. Keels,  The Song of Nadine

quote: But hope, I can tell you, is an exhausting emotion; perhaps, along with fear, the most exhausting of all. It is like juggling eggs: the hope is the shell, and inside is despair. A single crack and the despair might spill everywhere, stain everything.
author: Sam Taylor

quote: Thinking of death--strange, beautiful, terrible and a long way off--made me feel happier than ever.
author: Dodie Smith,  I Capture the Castle

quote: Grief can be the garden of compassion. If you keep your heart open through everything, your pain can become your greatest ally in your life's search for love and wisdom.
author: Rumi

quote: What is a man's life but a prelude to his death? And what is death but a long sleep, a most welcome forgetfulness.
author: Lisa M. Klein,  Ophelia
